  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] main)

    • resize

      public static String[][] resize​(String[][] array, boolean row_will_resize, boolean column_will_resize)
      Resizes a two-dimensional String array.
      Parameters:
      array - the original array to resize
      row_will_resize - if true, the number of rows will be doubled
      column_will_resize - if true, the number of columns will be doubled
      Returns:
      a new two-dimensional String array with the specified size

    • traverseTree

      public static void traverseTree​(DefaultMutableTreeNode node)
      Traverses a tree using depth-first search and prints the user object associated with each node. The children of each node are traversed recursively.
      Parameters:
      node - the root node of the tree to traverse

    • BFSsearchJTree

      public static void BFSsearchJTree​(DefaultMutableTreeNode root, String str)
      Performs a breadth-first search on a tree to find a specific node. Each node is added to a queue and processed in order.
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the tree to search
      str - the user object associated with the node to find

    • DFSsearchJTree

      public static void DFSsearchJTree​(DefaultMutableTreeNode root, String str)
      Performs a depth-first search on a tree to find a specific node. Each node is visited in a pre-order traversal, and the children are processed recursively.
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the tree to search
      str - the user object associated with the node to find

    • DFSsearchJTree

      public static int[] DFSsearchJTree​(String str, DefaultMutableTreeNode node, int[] arr)

    • postOrderTraversal

      public static void postOrderTraversal​(DefaultMutableTreeNode root, String str)
      Performs a post-order traversal of a tree to find a specific node. The children of each node are processed recursively before the parent node is visited.
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the tree to traverse
      str - the user object associated with the node to find

    • postOrderTraversal

      public static int[] postOrderTraversal​(String str, DefaultMutableTreeNode node, int[] arr)

    • moving_process

      public static void moving_process​(JTree tree)
      Moves a node in a JTree to a specified location. The path to the node to be moved and the destination are entered by the user.
      Parameters:
      tree - the JTree containing the node to be moved

    • search_for_moving

      public static boolean search_for_moving​(DefaultMutableTreeNode root, String[] str)
      Searches for a specific path in the tree rooted at the given node.
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the tree to search
      str - the array of strings representing the path to be found
      Returns:
      true if the path is found, false otherwise

    • TreeGeneratorWithPath

      public static JTree TreeGeneratorWithPath​(DefaultMutableTreeNode root, String[] str, String destination)
      Generates a new JTree containing the nodes in the specified path.
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the original tree
      str - the array of strings representing the path to be extracted
      destination - the name of the new root node for the generated tree
      Returns:
      a new JTree containing the nodes in the specified path

    • deleting_the_moved_part

      public static void deleting_the_moved_part​(DefaultMutableTreeNode node, String[] str, int count)
      Deletes the specified node and its descendants from the tree rooted at the given node.
      Parameters:
      node - the root node of the tree to modify
      str - the array of strings representing the path to be deleted
      count - the index of the current node in the path

    • transportation

      public static void transportation​(DefaultMutableTreeNode node, String destination, DefaultMutableTreeNode will_be_put)
      Moves the specified node and its descendants to the new location in the tree rooted at the given node.
      Parameters:
      node - the root node of the tree to modify
      destination - the name of the node where the moved nodes will be placed
      will_be_put - the root node of the subtree to be moved
